title: Stocks to Watch: Symantec, Tapestry, Church & Dwight
text:
By Ira Iosebashvili

Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Monday's session.

Symantec Corp.: The cybersecurity firm has received interest from a pair of private-equity suitors seeking to buy it for more than $16 billion after it agreed to a sale of a big chunk of its business, The Wall Street Journal reported Friday.

Tapestry Inc.: Shares of the handbag company gained nearly 15% last week following news that it ousted its chief executive.

Church & Dwight Co. Inc.: Shares of the maker of Arm & Hammer branded products fell nearly 5% last week after hedge-fund manager Spruce Point Capital accused the company of making bad acquisitions and masking financial weakness with questionable accounting practices.
